change your upload video's to MP4 or MKV
for high quality
720p - x264

What is x264?

x264 is an open-source encoder for the H.264 codec used for High-Definition movies on HD-DVDs and Blu-Ray Discs. It has a high compression which is way superior to xvid. That means you get more quality at equal bitrates. A 700MB x264 rip will be sharper and more detailed than a 700MB xvid rip from the same source. x264 is the future in DVDrips!

What is a .mkv file?

MKV means matroska video and it is a extensible open standard Audio/Video container (AVI is a container, too!). This file format combines several video streams, audiostreams, subtitles, chapters and information in only one file. It supports new standards like 6-channel AAC (Advanced Audio Coding) audio or x264 video

"The name R5 refers to DVD Region 5"
"R5 DVD can be almost indistinguishable from a DVDRip"

For everyone who is whining about incorrect tagging: R5 IS A DVDRIP FROM REGION 5 DVD. Why is it so hard to understand? R5-rip means nothing as R5 isn't a format. The source for R5 is a DVD so tagging Region 5 rips as DVDRips is fully acceptable. In fact, before the specification "R5" was introduced, these rips were actually called DVDRips.

The only difference between R5 and "real" DVDRip is that R5 lacks image post-processing. But the editing is minimal in many "real" DVDRips, so the difference in quality is rather small. Also, R5 has no extra features, but that isn't something we pirates are interested in anyway.

However, I agree that there should be a mention about the region where the rip comes from. At least for those who are only looking for the very best quality. In any case, naming these rips only as "R5" is totally incorrect and makes no sense. We use the "DVDRip" word with R1, R2 and global rips too so what's the point of not using it with R5. The correct name for these rips would be DVDRip(R5), R5-DVDRip or such.
